hail_focus_AJ: This Clan sure loves the sound of its own chatter, doesn't it? It's just a hail storm! What's the big deal?
These days, it seems like even the most inane yeek dung is enough to set everybody off.
That cloud up there looks kinda like a raindeer. Is everybody gonna be talking about that, next?
hail_focus_AJ1: [t_c rolls a large sphere of hail beneath {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} paws, gazing thoughtfully at its movement.]
Incredible, how precisely formed these spheres are, how perfect and smooth ...
It truly makes you wonder about the presence of a higher power, doesn't it, y_c? Were these balls of hail created by design? What is their significance?
And, were they created with intention, then why would The Ascended release them upon our camp to cause such devastation? Is it a form of divine punishment? An act of fate?
[You ask t_c if {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} paws are cold from rolling the ball of hail for so long.]
... Er, why, yes. I suppose they are.
hail_focus_AJ2: [A tiny pellet of hail strikes you from behind.]
What? Why are you looking at me? I didn't do anything.
[You turn around. Another hail pellet bounces off your rump.]
hail_focus_AJ2.5: [A tiny pellet of hail strikes you from behind.]
What? Why are you looking at me? I didn't do anything.
[You turn around. Another hail pellet bounces off your rump.]
hail_focus_AJ3: I wonder if we can make anything useful out of this hail storm ...
Maybe we could use some of the more sizeable pieces to roll branches from one side of camp to the other?
And the smaller ones could plug some of the holes in the dens! Or be toys for the pups!
[You ask t_c what's going to happen when the hail pellets melt?]
Oh, yeah, right. Melting. Forgot about that ...
Well, there's gotta be a solution for that as well, right? Maybe if we bury them deep enough in the ground and wait until leafbare, we could ... Uh ... Hmm ....
[t_c trails off into unintelligible muttering, seemingly talking to {PRONOUN/t_c/self} now more than to you.]
hail_focus_AJ4: [t_c dutifully works to repair the nursery, weaving strands of brambles into the puncture holes caused by the hail, ears pinned back in focus.]
[Since the storm, it seems like {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/haven't/hasn't} done much else!]
hail_focus_AJ5: [t_c stares apprehensively at the darkening skies.]
I hope it doesn't hail again ... Not after all the work we've done already.
hail_focus_AJ6: Void, y_c, did you hear that hail last night? It was crazy! It sounded like all of the stars dropped out of the sky at once!
Say, maybe that's not a bad idea ... Just think about it. Have you seen a star since the storm? Like, even once?
Yeah, I know it's been cloudy, but still!
hail_focus_AJ7: Uh -- A little helth? I'm a bit thuck.
[You whirl around to find t_c, whose tongue is fused to a huge pellet of hail.]
Come on, you can't thay that I'm the only one in camp whoth wondered what it tathes like!
[Try as you might to pry the pellet off of t_c's face, it's no use. {PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP}'ll just have to wait until it melts.]
Hey, at leatht I'm thaying hydrated! Haha!
hail_focus_AJ8: Tch. Stupid hail nearly made me jump out of my fur last night. Couldn't it have picked a better time to demolish camp than when I'm trying to get my much-needed beauty sleep?
Now, I'm gonna have to shift my afternoon nap up, just to fix my schedule ...
hail_focus_AJ9: [t_c and t_l bat a hail pellet back and forth, squealing with laughter.]
hail_focus_AJ10: [t_c tries and fails to balance atop a piece of hail, tiny paws scrabbling for balance.]
Wait, r_q! Just one more chance, please? I've almost got it!
hail_focus_AJ11: [t_c heaves a giant ball of hail towards the nursery, {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} little pelt soaked through from contact.]
Here it is! The giantest piece of hail in all of c_nClan history! I'm the one who found it! It was all me!
[Just then, r_k rolls an even bigger ball of hail through the entrance of the nursery, chased out by r_q's chidings about catching a cold.]
hail_focus_AJ12: [t_c tackles you out of nowhere, slamming you into the ground and smothering you with {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} fur.]
[Just as you're about to demand what gives, a tree branch bends overhead, sending hundreds of stone-like hail pellets spiraling down where you were just standing.]
hail_focus_AJ13: [t_c is brooding alone in {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} corner of camp, as always.]

[On your way to fetch more fresh moss, you remind {PRONOUN/t_c/object} that {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} supposed to be sheltering and should really only leave {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} den in an emergency.]
Tch, what's going to happen? A little hail is gonna kill me?
We're supposed to be warriors. Now, every slugcat's suddenly cowering like pups over a couple of pebbles.
hail_focus_AJ14: Oh, hey, y_c! I was just thinking of ways to help every slugcat pass time in the warrior's den until this whole storm thing is over.
Maybe we could play a game of moss-ball, like when all of us were pups? That could help lift every slugcat's spirits!
Though, on second thought, it just might give d_n a heart attack if any more damage is done to the dens, especially when there hasn't even been another hailstorm.
hail_focus_AJ15: Ugh, this hail is the worst! We have, like, triple our normal apprentice's duties!
None of the warriors had to go through this during their apprenticeships ... It really isn't fair!

I swear, for all this extra trouble, tm_n better take it easy on me once actual training starts again ... If I have to go back to doing drills after staying up all night fixing the nursery, I'm gonna lose it!
hail_focus_AJ16: I swear, sometimes it's like I'm the only one in this Clan who takes anything seriously!
I took it upon myself to redo the leader's den and half of the nursery, and was anyone there to help me? No!
[You point out to t_c that r_w offered to assist {PRONOUN/t_c/object}, but {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} freaked out over {PRONOUN/r_w/poss} 'imprecise weaving technique' and kicked them off the job.]
... Okay, point taken, but I was the only one who knew how to do it the right way!
hail_focus_AJ17: I really wanna help the warriors fix the nursery, but r_q says I'm not allowed, cuz it's too dangerous.
Ohhhh, what do I do, y_c? I need to work hard to show my Clanmates I'm smart, but I also don't wanna break a rule!
[t_c sits in {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} nest, seemingly paralyzed by the choice.]
hail_focus_AJ18: [The pups have temporarily taken over the warrior's den while the nursery is being repaired.]
[t_c sinks {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} paws into the moss of {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} nest, trying desperately to hold it together as the pups use {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} back as a temporary climbing gym.]
Any shot d_n would let me take my chances sleeping outside tonight?
hailstorm_focus_J1: [You catch a glimpse of t_c through the bramble border and ask boldly if {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} had anything to do with the harsh storm that just pummelled the Clan.]
[t_c snickers, entirely unintimidated by your accusation.]
No, no, I would never be so mean! Maybe you guys should be doing a better job protecting them instead of pointing paws, huh?
hailstorm_focus_J2: Hm? Oh, yeah, just tired. The kits have been running around all day, trying to help clean up after the storm, getting in the way and tripping up warriors.
I challenged them all to see who could make the biggest hail pile, though, and that seems to have distracted them.
[You and t_c glance backwards towards the nursery, where the pups are scrambling to collect as many hailstones as possible to push into their pile.]
hailstorm_focus_J3: [As t_c does {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} best to patch up the hail damage on the clerics' den, you ask how {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} doing.]
Hm? Oh, fine, fine. Just, you know, a bit annoyed at all of this.
I guess I'm just glad the hail didn't injure any slugcat too badly.
[You tell t_c that, actually, a pellet managed to hit you in the paw and it's feeling a bit sore.]
Get in the den. I'll look at it in a moment.
hailstorm_kitten_H1~1: Next time, I'm going to be prepared! I've been practicing dodging it!
[t_c starts to show you how {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} would 'dodge' the balls of ice, jumping from side to side.]
[t_c proceeds to trip over {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} own paws and tumbles, squeaking and giggling.]
hailstorm_kitten_H1~2: [You stop to peek over a group of warriors shoulders, catching sight of t_c jumping side to side, teaching other slugpups on how to 'dodge' the balls of ice if the storm ever happens again.]
Like this, like this! Then, if the ice ever does rain again, we can outsmart it and dodge! Just like r_w says we should do if something is coming after us.
[The slugputs attempt to follow t_c's movements, yet they trip over each other in a heep of giggles. At least the pups are entertained.]
